channel.title: Fake guitars
channel.description:
I was looking for guitars at a cheap price and stumbled across this website: [url=http://www.ioffer.com]www.ioffer.com[/url]
After scrolling through, I found them selling Gibson, not Epiphone, Les pauls for 300-400$. As any guitarist knows, these guitars range from $2,000-$15,000. Now, I've done some research to find a fake Les Paul, and ALL of these guitars have accurate pieces that are typically done wrong by China or 3rd world country manufacturing.
[url=http://www.ioffer.com/i/gibson-custom-shop-les-paul-custom-ebony-guitar-212332200]http://www.ioffer.com/i/gibson-custom-shop-les-paul-custom-ebony-guitar-212332200[/url] That guitar would be retailed at around $3000, here it is for $300.
I need help to know if these are fakes, because some of these guitars look REALLY nice, but I don't want them if they're shitty Chinese fakes.

item.title: Fake guitars
item.dc:creator: @m.dog311 m.dog311
item.description:
@m.dog311 wrote:



Hmm?

item.title: Fake guitars
item.dc:creator: @m.dog311 m.dog311
item.description:
@m.dog311 wrote:

Anyways, have you searched “Gibson Custom Shop Les Paul Custom Ebony Guitar” on Google images? The same images that hes showing are plastered all over Google. Some are just the pictures, and some have the iOffer watermarks with other users names

Read full topic

item.title: Fake guitars
item.dc:creator: @badger41 badger41
item.description:
@badger41 wrote:

[quote=“I Vain I”][quote author=m.dog311 link=topic=499263.msg3651185#msg3651185 date=1309742458]
I wouldn’t trust it. Honestly, if you’re looking for an affordable Les Paul, just go with an Epiphone. I have this one, http://www.guitarcenter.com/Epiphone-Les-Paul-Standard-Plain-Top-Electric-Guitar-100237216-i1320937.gc, and I absolutely love it. Obviously, it’s not a $3000 guitar, but it’s still an amazing guitar.
[/quote]PAGE NOT FOUND[/quote]

remove the comma at the end lol

Edit: you beat me to it fffuuu

Read full topic

item.title: Fake guitars
item.dc:creator: @reyx7 reyx7
item.description:
@reyx7 wrote:

Did some more research. I took the serial number on the back of one of the headstocks, and put it into this: http://guitardaterproject.org/gibson.aspx

And it told me it was made in Nashville, TN. The official Gibson factory.
Still don’t know it I can trust.

Read full topic
